Title: The People vs. Larry Flynt
Production_Co: Columbia Pictures Corporation, Filmhaus, Illusion Entertainment
Cast: Woody Harrelson, Courtney Love, Edward Norton, Brett Harrelson, Donna Hanover, James Cromwell, Crispin Glover, Vincent Schiavelli, Miles Chapin, James Carville, Richard Paul, Burt Neuborne, Jan Tr√≠ska, Cody Block, Ryan Post
Plot: A partially idealized film of the controversial pornography publisher and how he became a defender of free speech for all people. Larry Flynt is the hedonistically obnoxious, but indomitable, publisher of Hustler magazine. The film recounts his struggle to make an honest living publishing his porn magazine and how it changes into a battle to protect the freedom of speech for all people. Written by Kenneth Chisholm <kchishol@execulink.com>
Keywords: magazine, hustler magazine, publishing, publisher, strip club
Awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 22 wins & 31 nominations.
Location: Abandoned train station, Memphis, Tennessee, USA
Actors: Woody Harrelson, Courtney Love, Edward Norton
Description: Directed by Milos Forman.  With Woody Harrelson, Courtney Love, Edward Norton, Brett Harrelson. A partially idealized film of the controversial pornography publisher and how he became a defender of free speech for all people.
